I want to start a job from command line. I've noticed that you can use the =
following command in order to start a particular job based upon a profile:
=

bin/heritrix --run conf/profiles/myprofile/order.xml 

But if heritrix is =
it already running, the job will never get started, and the only way I've f=
ound to stop heritrix is via browser using the user interface.

My question=
 is, is there any way to start the job once heritrix is already running? Or=
 is there any way to tell heritrix to shut down once certain job is finishe=
d?
